intro: Pilosella brachiata subsp. cineracea, commonly known as the cineraceous hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its finely hairy, grayish-green leaves and yellow composite flowers that bloom in summer. Native to regions of Europe and parts of Asia, this subspecies thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and has a compact, upright growth habit. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and often overlooked member of the hawk's-beard genus.
